c-2: ^What are your thoughts on the others in the archipelago?

c-0: ^What's your story? How did you come to live here?
^I came here with my sister around ten years ago. No, longer than that.
^It's not much of a story, if I'm being honest.
^We stumbled upon this place, thought it was interesting, and decided to stay for a while.
^If I'm being honest, I only stayed here for her sake. She's the explorer between the two of us.
^As you can probably imagine, I prefer to stay inside with my electronics.
^And then, y'know, some things happened and now I'm here without her.
^Anyway, let's move on. Got any other questions?
c-1: ^Do you ever want to leave this place?
^Just not without my sister. I can't.
^That's all I have to say about it. Next question!
c-2: ^Roger that. What else do you want to talk about?

c-0: ^I'm not sure if he realizes it, but Bengt has been a huge help to me!
^It was hard for me to stay positive after my sister went missing. I just wanted to keep to myself.
^But then he came to me looking for help with a project of his.
^I swear, I hadn't left my house in weeks at that point. It was nice to be around another person again.
^I didn't realize I needed that. It made me feel... a little more at home here.
^Since then, each day has felt a little easier. I opened up more, made some friends, had some laughs.
^But enough about that! Is there anyone else you're curious about?
c-1: ^Sigrid keeps to herself a lot. It's hard to get a read on her.
^Plus, she seems kinda awkward anytime I talk to her...
^She doesn't mince her words around anyone else, I've noticed. Only me.
^At first I figured she's just closed off to outsiders, but it's been over a decade!
^Wouldn't she consider me a fellow resident at this point? Agh, it's frustrating!
^I wish I had more to say. Is there anyone else you're curious about?
c-3: ^Roger that. What else do you want to talk about?

c-0: ^Ulrich seems to be as allergic to electronics as he is to his own plants!
^I have no common ground with him! And I can hardly understand him in the first place.
^It doesn't seem like the archipelago was very technologically advanced before I got here.
^From what I know, Ulrich has lived here a very long time. He must prefer to stick to his old ways.
^That's not to say there's any ill will between us!
^He even brought me a bunch of flowers as condolences after my sister disappeared.
^At least, I think that's why he brought them? I, uh, couldn't decipher what he was saying.
^Is there anyone else you're curious about?
c-1: ^I'm totally lost on all this ecosystem stuff she's so passionate about...
^I know it's important, and I make sure to dispose of my electronic scraps safely so I don't mess it up!
^But to dedicate so much time and energy into a bunch of water... I mean, wow.
^That was a good kind of "wow", by the way! Her work is impressive, really!
^She's an avid explorer, as well. Ah, my sister used to chat with her day and night!
^Honestly, my sister has much more in common with her than I do.
^Still, Vera and I get along well enough on our own.
^Is there anyone else you're curious about?
c-3: ^Roger that. What else do you want to talk about?

c-0: ^Roger that. What else do you want to talk about?
c-1: ^What was it you said, that Ulrich listens to some radio show...?
^[Irma looks around and then leans in close, like she's about to spill a secret.]
^There's only one program our radios can pick up on from all the way out here...
^It's this out-loud reading of a really, REALLY sappy book series.
^I caught Ulrich listening to it once, and I'm pretty sure I caught tears in his eyes! Like, actual tears!
^I don't have the guts to bring it up to him, myself! Gosh, that would be scary!
^But if you're ever feeling brave enough to do it, don't tease him too hard.
c-2: ^I'd like to take a crack at those riddles!
^Now you're speaking my language! How about...
c-3: ^Where do you take a sick boat?
^Aw, okay that one was easy! How about...
^What's a vampire's favorite boat to travel on?
^Are all your riddles boat-related, by the way?
^My riddle arsenal is a bit limited, I admit.
^How about I challenge you to a few? You game?

riddle1: ^A girl has as many brothers as sisters, but each brother has only half as many brothers as sisters...
^How many brothers and sisters are there in the family?

c-1: ^Oof, nope! I'll repeat it for you...
c-2: ^Oof, nope! I'll repeat it for you...
c-3: ^Hmm... could you repeat the riddle for me?

riddle2: ^A is the brother of B. B is the brother of C. C is the father of D.

c-0: ^No, no! I'll repeat it for you...
c-2: ^No, no! I'll repeat it for you...
c-3: ^Hmm... could you repeat the riddle for me?

riddle3: ^I dance in the wind and I bow to a storm...
^I grow best in temperatures that are warm...
^By the riverbeds, I like to grow, where the people in boats like to row...

c-0: ^That I am not! I'll repeat it for you...
c-1: ^That I am! You got me all figured out!
^I'm all out of riddles now, so how about you give that brain of yours a rest?
^Right, was there anything else you wondered about?
c-2: ^That I am not! I'll repeat it for you...
c-3: ^Hmm... could you repeat the riddle for me?

exitRiddles: ^Bummer! That's alright, let me know whenever you'd like to work your brain out with me!
